Interface PublicUserFinder

      Returns:
      the query result

    • findVisibleByCriteria

      IQueryBeanResult<User> findVisibleByCriteria(UserSearchCriteria criteria)
      Returns all the visible users that match the search criteria. Visible users that are in groups that are in the same security zone(s) as the current user unless the current user has the special "view all users" permission, in which case all users are visible.

      One special case: if the UserSearchCriteria.isNotInAnyGroup() flag is set, then users that are not in a group are returned even though they are, strictly, not visible. In this case, the restriction on the organization will be in play.

      Parameters:
      criteria - user search criteria
      Returns:
      the query results

    • findUnassignedUsers

      IQueryBeanResult<User> findUnassignedUsers()
      Returns all users that are not assigned to any group,
      Returns:
      the query result

    • findUsersSharingGroupsWithUser

      IQueryBeanResult<User> findUsersSharingGroupsWithUser(Key userID)
      Returns all users that are in any of the groups of that the supplied user is also a member.
      Parameters:
      userID - the id of the user
      Returns:
      the query results

    • findUsersIsBackupUserFor

    • findByExternalUserIgnoreRetired

      IQueryBeanResult<User> findByExternalUserIgnoreRetired(boolean externalUsers)
      Returns all internal or external users, depending on externalUsers argument. This will also include users who are no longer active (their bean has been removed and is retired).
      Parameters:
      externalUsers - whether external users only or internal users only
      Returns:
      The query results

    • findExternalUsersIgnoreRetired

      default IQueryBeanResult<User> findExternalUsersIgnoreRetired()
      Returns all external users. This will also include users who are no longer active (their bean has been removed and is retired).
      Returns:
      The query results

    • findInternalUsersIgnoreRetired

      default IQueryBeanResult<User> findInternalUsersIgnoreRetired()
      Returns all internal users. This will also include users who are no longer active (their bean has been removed and is retired).
      Returns:
      The query results

    • findByUserID

      IQueryBeanResult<User> findByUserID(Key userID)
      Returns query results from a find against the database for the user with the given id.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user to find
      Returns:
      The query results (should be only one)

      the query results
